page.title: 15HIGH PARK ESTATE.
page.content: The approach to{High Park Estate}is via a dirt drive lined with a variety of trees including a number of beech, sycamore, laurel, oak and mountain ash. There are rhododendron bushes too which were evidently planted when the house was built around 1900. Half way up the drive there is a caravan site, the{caravans}being used as permanent homes. At the end of the road stands the large house now divided into{flats and in need of some attention. Near to it are some disused farm buildings, an empty pond and a modern{bungalow. Originally the surrounding land belonged to High Park House but the fields are now used for hay and grazing. What was once the deer park is now used for sheep. Some{St. Mark's}children visited this former estate in June 1985.
